intro: Kraenzlinella platyrachis, commonly known as the broad-leaved kraenzlinella, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its broad, leathery leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in montane forest environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
